page.title: 11RECREATION
page.content: { FREE TIME IN CARRINGTON} All of the recreation clubs in Carrington take place in the village hall. The hall was completed in 1984 and was built at a cost of Â£92,000. The hall is used by the citizens of Carrington and the neighbouring village of Temple. Many different organisations use the village hall. Badminton, bridge, bowling, table tennis and pool clubs all meet regularly. There is a Womens Rural Institute that also meets every month. A playgroup is held in the hall. Only 10 children attend this playgroup.When these children are older they will have to attend the primary school in Temple.
